mdraw.shapes

Class Group

  • java.lang.Object
    • mdraw.shapes.Group
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Shape

    public class Group
extends Object
implements Shape
    Class for grouping shapes into a group which is again a Shape. Has a set of sub-shapes. Group implements the Composite pattern for shapes.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    hp

    • Field Summary

      Elements of this group

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Shape copy()
      Makes a deep copy of this group by making copies of all the elements of the group and then returning a new group with the copied elements.
      void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws this group by drawing all elements in the group.
      void fill(Graphics g, Color c)
      Fills this group by fill all elements in the group.
      Shape[] getElements()
      Gets the elements of this group.
      int getHeight()
      Gets the height of this group by computing the difference of the top and the bottom coordinate.
      int getLeft()
      Gets the left border coordinate of this group by computing the minimum of the left borders of all the elements.
      int getTop()
      Gets the top border coordinate of this group by computing the minimum of the top borders of all the elements.
      int getWidth()
      Gets the width of this group by computing the difference of the left and the right coordinate.
      boolean isSelection(int x, int y)
      Determines if the x/y coordinate means a selection of this group.
      void setPos(int x, int y)
      Sets the position of this group.
      void setSize(int w, int h)
      Sets the size of this group.

      • isSelection

        public boolean isSelection(int x,
                           int y)
        Determines if the x/y coordinate means a selection of this group. The group is selected if one of its elements is selected by the mouse position.
        Specified by:
        isSelection in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if x/y means a selection of this shape, false otherwise
